intro: Myosurus tenellus, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale blue or pink flowers. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and blooms from late spring to early summer. Myosurus tenellus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in well-drained conditions.
